title: Online Teaching Assistant - PUBH 240
description:
Teaching Assistants are needed for the PUBH 240: Intro to Public Health class. Applicants must have passed the course with an A- or better, have good interpersonal skills (cultural awareness), and exceptional English Writing and reading skills.  Teaching Assistants are needed to do the following in the class:
• Grade the Preparation Assignments based on the rubrics provided in the course
• Notify instructor of incomplete or substandard student work for the instructor to address
• Regrade Preparation Assignment resubmissions upon approval
• Grade the weekly discussion boards (current event and job-of-the-week posts).
Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. TAs work in instructional teams. Timely completion of assigned work is crucial to success. TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working everyday to make sure all tasks are done on time.
For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

Please upload your unofficial transcript to this application by following the steps below:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application
summary: Teaching Assistants are needed for the PUBH 240: Intro to Public Health class. Applicants must have passed the course with an A- or better, have good interpersonal skills (cultural awareness), and exceptional English Writing and reading skills. Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. See job description for more detail.
approximateHoursPerWeek: Up to 19 hours or when the work is done

title: Online Tutor - GER 101
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the GER 101: Beginning German I. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: MC Afternoon Custodian
description:
Job includes: cleaning restrooms, basic cleaning (dusting, wiping tables/chairs, sweeping, mopping, etc.), helping with event setup/take down, and other responsibilities as directed by supervisor.

Please be aware that the physical requirements of this job include:

  • Carpet cleaning
  • Custodial work including the cleaning of restrooms and offices
  • Operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment
  • Walking and pushing carts
  • Carrying supplies and tools
  • The ability to lift up to 50 pounds required
  • Working with chemicals
  • Lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, and standing for a 3 hour shift
  • And other assignments as requested
summary:
Shift is 2:30 PM-5:30 PM, Monday through Friday, and some Saturdays. THIS SCHEDULE IS FIRM.
Job includes: cleaning restrooms, basic cleaning (dusting, wiping tables/chairs, sweeping, mopping, etc.), helping with event setup/take down, and other responsibilities as directed by supervisor.

title: Catering Services Lead
description:
Qualifications
  • Valid driver license
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Must be polite, courteous, respectful, and maintain a professional appearance
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels within an organization
  • Must be able to work a flexible schedule with early start times
We are looking for someone off track during the Fall semester. This position offers at least 20 hrs a week with the opportunity for more hours based on Catering needs.
Flexible Schedule
Starting at $12 PER HOUR and DISCOUNT ON FOOD each day you work.
summary: In the role of Catering Lead, you will work in a fast-paced environment to ensure that our guests receive great food and service

title: Food Services Student Jobs
description:
Fast-paced, demanding job.  We need dependable, hard-working, and punctual people. Set times for positions. Must be willing to learn and take on more responsibilities as the job requires.

AVAILABLE SHIFTS

Special Cleaner | Mon & Fri 2:30 pm - 6:20 pm, Sat 9 am-7 pm

Crossroads Lunch Block | 10:30 am - 2:00 pm

Garden View | 11:00 am - 2:30pm

Chick Fil A | 1:35pm - 5:20pm & 10:45am - 2:30pm

Promotions are available based on performance.
summary: Fall Food Service Jobs Start at $10 PER HOUR and $3 DISCOUNT ON FOOD each day you work. We are looking for dynamic individuals who know how to work hard and can adapt to change in a fast-paced environment. Must be able to stand for long periods and lift up to 50 lbs. Learn and take on more responsibilities as we go through semester.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 20-Oct

description:
An online teaching assistant (TA) is needed for AGBUS 180B: Cash Accounting Concepts and Applications.  Applicants must have passed AGBUS 180B and ECON 255 with a B or better. The TA will grade Excel Assignments. There will be a paid online certification training (2-3 hours) before working as a TA starts. If you have any questions please email the BYUI Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu, or call us at (208) 496-1595. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process.

title: Testing Center Proctor
description:
This application is regarding the Fall 2022 Semester.

While an individual shift may vary at times, these are the typical expectations of a shift:

Proctoring:

  • Proctor students as they take their online and paper/pencil exams in the Testing Center
  • Proctor 4 areas in 15-minute increments over the period of an hour.
  • Confidently address sensitive matters, such as integrity reports and other Honor Code violations;
  • Must be physically capable of standing for extensive periods of time
  • Input passwords for computer exams

Handling Exams:

  • Administer online and paper/pencil exams to students in a professional manner
  • Accurately file exams in alphabetic and numerical order
  • Employee will learn computer programs (TARS/Akindi/Proctorio)

Your application MUST include A VIDEO introduction about yourself.

Please follow the steps below...

- Go to https://streamable.com/ and upload your video. If you use your phone, you can record your video directly from their site.

- Please email tcassistantsbyui@gmail.com with a link to your video.

- 2-3 Minutes long

  • Please include the following information about yourself:
  • Your full name
  • Your major
  • What your track is 
  • When you graduate
  • Why you stand out among our applicants
  • What shift(s) would you be able to work
  • How many hours would you want
  • Include any other information you want us to know about you. 

Shift's that we are looking to fill: 

Tue/Th/Sat 7:30-10:00 AM, 12:30-3:30 PM

- Shifts are linked by Mon/Wed/Fri OR Tues/Thurs/Sat
(ex. If you work Monday, you also work the same time on Wednesday and Friday)

Required  to be Considered for Position:

  • Resume 

  • Fall 2022 class schedule

  • 2 years (or more) of school remaining

  • Willingness to work during finals/ before holidays

  • English proficiency

  • Academic standing/ high level of integrity

  • Good work ethic (arrives on time, respects superiors, accepts correction)

  • Demonstrate attention to detail

  • Must follow FERPA policies/ Honor Code/ Dress and Grooming.
summary: This position would be regarding Fall 2022 Semester. As a BYU-I Testing Center proctor, you would be expected to administer exams, proctor students in person/online, file exams and learn Testing Center software.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 8-20 per week

title: Online Teaching Assistant - ARCH 270
description:
Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process.

Duties:  Monitor Questions Central discussion board. The instructor and TA will collaborate together to make several lab times available to students throughout the week using Zoom. TAs will also be available to help students understand course concepts, and provide formative feedback on assignments. TAs work in instructional teams. Timely completion of assigned work is crucial to success. TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working every day to make sure all tasks are done on time.

title: Online Teaching Assistant - PUBH 240
description:
Teaching Assistants are needed for the PUBH 240: Intro to Public Health class. Applicants must have passed the course with an A- or better, have good interpersonal skills (cultural awareness), and exceptional English Writing and reading skills.  Teaching Assistants are needed to do the following in the class:
• Grade the Preparation Assignments based on the rubrics provided in the course
• Notify instructor of incomplete or substandard student work for the instructor to address
• Regrade Preparation Assignment resubmissions upon approval
• Grade the weekly discussion boards (current event and job-of-the-week posts).
Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. TAs work in instructional teams. Timely completion of assigned work is crucial to success. TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working everyday to make sure all tasks are done on time.
For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: Online Teaching Assistant - BUS 410
description:
A Teaching Assistant is needed for BUS 410 online. This class was formerly known as B 483. To qualify for the position, you must be a business major and have a GPA of 3.5 or higher. The position would require around  3-5 hrs per section for a proposed 3 sections of work per week. The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah. This course has a heavy grading and group management load. TAs are needed in this course to reduce instructor load and facilitate deeper learning. TA Weekly duties: 1) Review the group meeting evaluations 2. Provide grade entry for the Pre-Discussion Polls for each case. 3) Provide grade entry for all other post-discussion Polls.

TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working every day to make sure all tasks are done on time. The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah.

Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts

 

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

title: Admissions Student Processor
description:
Scan data entry documents, open and deliver mail, fold and mail out admissions letters, participate in reading applications, and preform other duties as requested. Candidate must have proficient and accurate computer skills. Attention to detail a must, willing to do repetitive work.Someone who is self motivated and willing to take on extra duties.

Preference given to candidates who can commit to longevity.
summary: Scan data entry documents, open and deliver mail, fold and mail out admissions letters, participate in reading applications, and preform other duties as requested.

title: Grounds Crew 4
description: Installing, removing sprinkler systems, and general sprinkler maintenance on campus.  Caring for campus grounds and plants, weeding, raking, shoveling, lifting up to 50 pounds, sod replacement, other jobs as requested by the supervisor. Irrigation experience preferred but not required.
summary: There are two different shifts available:  Position 1 is 7am-11am Monday through Friday and as needed.  Position 2 is 11am-3pm Monday through Friday and as needed.  (A 4 hour block for each position.)  Anticipated start date is April 18th.  Caring for the grounds on campus including sprinkler installation, removal and general maintenance of sprinkler systems.  This position includes digging and lifting 50 pounds.  YOU MUST HAVE A DRIVERS LICENSE.

title: Grounds Crew 8
description:
Caring for campus grounds and plants, weeding, raking, shoveling, lifting up to 75 pounds, sod replacement, snow removal during the winter, mowing during the summer, and other jobs as requested by the supervisor.

*Must be able to work a 3-4 hour shifts between the hours of 7 a.m.-11 a.m.
summary: Caring for the campus grounds and plants.  Must be available especially on Tuesday and Thursday during the week.  Also looking for you to fill a 3-4 hour shift Monday-Friday between 7 a.m.-11 a.m.

title: Online Tutor - BIO 381
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the BIO 381: Pathophysiology. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: Online Tutor - BIO 264
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the BIO 264. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: Clinician Aide
description:
PRINCIPLE DUTIES

  • Vital Signs and Charting: Take blood pressure (by machine and manually), heart rate (by machine and manually), pulse oximetry, temperature (oral and axillary), and respirations. Accompany patient to assigned exam room and record vital signs, chief complaints, and allergies in chart.
  • Minor Procedures: Assist providers with mole removals, skin biopsies, toenail removals, sutures, lacerations, and other procedures as assigned (based on competency and provider assignment).
  • Medical Supplies: Ensure exam rooms are properly stocked with all medical supplies.
  • Other Tasks: Assist nurses and providers in organization of training materials, answering phone calls, transporting patient material to providers, giving breathing treatments, packaging pathology specimens, and cleaning equipment at end of day. Perform tasks as assigned by Student Clinician Aid Manager or registered nurse.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Education and Work Experience: Experience in a similar position is required.
  • Skill Set: Ability to think critically, communicate clearly, keep organized, manage time wisely, behave professionally, practice hospitality, take initiative to complete tasks, work quickly and accurately under pressure, accept direction from others, and work well in groups. Basic understanding and working knowledge of computers.
  • License or Certification: Current MA, CNA, EMT, RN, or Paramedic certification and CPR card preferred; no license or certification required if applicant has significant experience (as determined by head nurse).
  • Time Commitment: 3 semester commitment preferred.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

  • Please do not apply through this website. Email your resume, cover letter, and class schedule to healthcenterclinicianaid@byui.edu
  • Please include your chosen major

IMPORTANT: All employees of the Student Health Center are required to receive or have record of the following immunizations: 
     TB (must be updated annually)
     FLU (must be current for this season)
     TDAP (must be updated every 10 years)
     MMR (2 doses)
     VARICELLA (Chicken pox - 2 doses)
     HEPATITIS B (3 doses)

NOTE: The Student Health Center can administer most immunizations as necessary. All student employees are financially responsible for completing this requirement. You will be requested to provide records during general training. The SHC must have record of the above immunizations before on-the-job training begins.
summary: Assist health care providers and nursing staff with anything related to patient care. Allow for timely and efficient movement of patients through Student Health Center.

description:

  • Carpet cleaning
  • Custodial work including the cleaning of restrooms and offices
  • Operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment
  • Walking and pushing carts
  • Carrying supplies and tools
  • The ability to lift up to 50 pounds required
  • Working with chemicals
  • Lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, and standing
  • And other assignments as requested

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: Career Success Mentor
description:
We are seeking enthusiastic individuals who can be flexible in a changing environment as we restructure the way we deliver Job Market Readiness appointments. The Career Success Mentor is responsible for coaching students through a 4 step method which includes:

1. Teaching how to create an employer list of companies and identifying alumni or contacts who work there.

2. Teaching how to reach out to alumni or contacts to request and conduct informational interviews.

3. Teaching students how stay in close proximity to their contacts and to employers through follow up and other strategies.

4. Identifying areas students may need additional help in to successfully find internships or employment at graduation such as: Reviewing résumés and interviewing skills through VMock, cover letter help, and creating strong digital profiles in LinkedIn and BYU-I Connect, etc.

Career Success Mentors coach students on these topics during 25 minute one-on-one appointments. We are looking for applicants who have the ability to ask questions and discern what help students need within the 4 steps mentioned above. Applicants will also have a strong command of the English language, with the ability to write clearly and edit well (according to English spelling, grammar, etc. standards). Someone competent using software like Word, PowerPoint, Handshake, VMock, Outlook, and design programs like Adobe Creative Cloud and Canva.

Career Success Mentors will also give presentations on Job Market Readiness skills to classrooms and society meetings when requested. Must be comfortable interacting with students, faculty, and staff. Must be able to communicate ideas clearly. Students from all majors with these skills are encouraged to apply.

NOTE: Students hired must commit to serving in this position for two consecutive semesters.

Required Qualifications

  • Strong command of English language both verbal and written; ability to write clearly and edit well (according to English spelling, grammar, etc. standards)
  • Teachable, conscientious, customer-centric, highly dependable, & punctual
  • Must be able to work one of the following shifts Monday - Friday: 8 am - 11 am, 11 am to 2 pm, or 2 pm to 5 pm (We need 8-11 and 11-2 shifts filled for fall semester)
  • Attend weekly training meetings every Thursday during the forum hour between 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM

Preferred Qualifications

  • Successful completion of BUS 320: Advanced Writing in Professional Contexts (or other 300-level advanced writing course)
  • Successful office and/or customer services experience
  • Successful completion of a professional internship
  • Successful experience training/leading/mentoring others
  • Ability to work well under pressure
  • Excellent organization and problem-solving skills
  • Competent with Excel, databases, and/or social media platforms
  • Knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud a plus
  • Ability to quickly learn online tools such as Handshake, Portfolium, LinkedIn, I-Learn (Canvas), VMock, etc.

To Apply

Please submit the following four items by Wednesday, August 24:

  • Résumé
  • Cover Letter,
  • BYU-Idaho Transcript
  • 3 professional references

(please note a complete application will include all four documents requested, incomplete applications will not be considered)
summary: Hiring for Fall Semester 2022 - offering training two weeks prior to the start of fall semester. Career Success Mentors teach students how to find professional contacts and conduct informational interviews. They also teach guidelines for résumés and interviewing using VMock, and how to create digital profiles on LinkedIn and BYU-I Connect, etc. via one-on-one in-person and remote appointments.

TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working everyday to make sure all tasks are done on time and grade Stepping Stone assignments and, monitor weekly topic channel in MS Teams.

For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at 208-496-1595 or oas.employment@byui.edu.

Please include a copy of your unofficial transcripts.

 1. Sign into the BYUI website

title: Online Tutor - CSE 212 or CS 241
description:
Online Tutor is needed for CS 241: Programming with Data Structures. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: Ropes Course Facilitator
description:
Responsibilities
A facilitator’s primary responsibilities include
•Facilitating high and low ropes course activities for a diverse community, including youth, adults, and people with disabilities
•Facilitating ground initiatives focused on team building, leadership, and group dynamics
•Facilitating group debriefs after each activity to draw out fundamental principles with real life applications
•Performing routine assembly, inspection, and maintenance of adventure course and associated equipment
•Keeping applicable records
•Attending weekly staff meetings/trainings
In addition, facilitators may be expected to:
•Operate the information booth on campus
•Facilitate crate stacking activities
•Work special events at the course or on campus
•Perform any other duties as assigned
Skills & Qualifications
•Must be a current student at BYU-Idaho
•Must be at least 18 years of age or older
•Ability to obtain CPR/First Aid training within first 6 months of employment
•Ability to complete 40 hours of site-specific training and pass the associated written and practical examinations at the conclusion of training
•Ability to work with climbing equipment, stand and be active for up to 8 hours at a time in all weather conditions, and perform rescues for participants weighing up to 285lbs
•Ability to lift and carry 15-30lbs on a regular basis, and up to 75lbs on an occasional basis
•Previous challenge course, zipline, or climbing experience (preferred)
•Ability to maintain professionalism while fostering the fun and excitement the challenge course has to offer
•Must have exceptional interpersonal and teamwork skills
summary:
Summary

As a ropes course facilitator, you get to experience Rexburg like never before! Standing (or hanging)45 feet in the air, you'll be responsible for the safety and satisfaction of our guests. As you lead groups through various activities and course obstacles, you’ll see people step out of their comfort zones and into a place of real learning and growth.

Starting pay: $9.60/hour

Approximate hours per week: 5 -40 hours

Work schedule: Varies by week
approximateHoursPerWeek: 8-35 Hours

title: Front Desk Reception
description:
As a Front Desk Receptionist in the Accounting Services office, you will be working in a professional atmosphere, representing the University and upholding its standards. Your duties will include professionally resolving incoming questions over the phone and with walk-in customers, creating I-Cards, processing daily reports, and working on other projects as needed.

Customer service is a key component of this position. Employees will be expected to maintain a business professional mindset while extending excellent customer service.

We are looking for students who:

  • Enjoy working with others and helping to resolve issues
  • Demonstrate clear and effective communication skills
  • Exhibit an ability to work well with many demands placed on their time
  • Have a positive attitude and motivate others to do the same
  • Adapt well to change
  • Previous experience working in a financial or billing office preferred

This position is a Monday through Friday commitment of 15 hours each week.

The available shift time is:

  • 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

Please only apply if you are available to work during this shift.
summary: The duties will include professionally resolving incoming questions over the phone and with walk-in customers, creating I-Cards, processing daily reports, and working on other projects as needed.

title: Biddulph/Rigby  Early Morning Custodian
description: Carpet cleaning and custodial work around campus including restrooms and offices, operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment, walking and pushing carts, carrying supplies and tools, lifting up to 50 pounds is regularly required, working with chemicals, lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, standing for 3 hour shift. Other assignments as requested.
summary: Cleaning campus buildings. Shift is 4:30am-7:30am Monday-Friday and some Saturdays as required by the building assigned, approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: Online Tutor - CHILD 210
description:
Online Tutor is needed for CHILD 210: Child Development. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: Online Teaching Assistant - FHGEN 242
description:
Teaching Assistant is needed for FHGEN 112 online. To qualify for the position, you must have completed FHGEN 111 and 112 with an A. The Teaching Assistant should also be pursuing an Applied Associate's in Family History or an Interdisciplinary Degree with a concentration in Family History. The position would require around 5 hours of work per week. Weekly duites include: 1. Review lesson material (prepare) 2. Monitor and participate in Questions & Conversations DB 3. Facilitate and grade discussions (TOA) 4. Teaching assistant's mentor students as requested by students or Instructor. 5. Other assignments as specified by Instructor. The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah.

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

title: Financial Reporting Student Employee
description:
As assets are received on campus they are registered in the accounting system and tagged with a barcode that is scanned periodically during the inventory process.

Complete audits between University accounting system and other tracking systems used on campus.

Other duties may include assisting with monthly reporting package.
summary: Business asset tagging and scanning.  This is a control performed on campus to ensure assets purchased by the University are properly used and maintained. May also help with monthly reporting requirements and other projects.

title: Online Teaching Assistant - FAML 460
description:
A Teaching Assistant is needed for the FAML 460 class: Child and Family Advocacy. Applicants must have taken the class and received aa B+ or better. The TA will help the instructor with administrative tasks such as grading and giving feedback. Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah.

TAs work in instructional teams. Timely completion of assigned work is crucial to success. TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working everyday to make sure all tasks are done on time.

For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at 208-496-1595 or email us at oas.employment@byui.edu. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process.

title: Online Tutor - BUS 374: Social Innovation
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the BUS 374 class. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

description:
Online Tutor is needed for the CITBC 150. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 

Please up-load your unofficial transcript to this application by following the steps below:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

title: IT Service Desk Analyst
description:
JOB DETAILS

Title: IT Service Desk Analyst

Posted: 4/29/2022

Job Summary:

The IT Service Desk acts as the single point of contact (SPOC) for the IT department. As such, we provide technical support for all IT services and products. This is accomplished by providing customer service through the phone, chat, walk-up, and email channels. Applicants must be able to demonstrate proficiency in technical problem-solving and customer service.

Job Description:

The Service Desk Analyst is an IT professional who assists in resolving or reporting incidents, fulfilling service requests, and ensuring accurate adherence to standardized Service Level Agreements (SLA’s). The Analyst accomplishes this by utilizing the training, tools, and knowledge provided by the IT department. This knowledge and training is enhanced by the Knowledge Centered Service model and is facilitated by the IT Knowledge Base and its curators, engineers, and other support personnel. All incidents and service requests are documented in our IT Service Management (ITSM) tool for trend identification, data analysis, appropriate incident escalation, service request routing, etc. The Analyst is tasked with balancing creative and technical problem-solving, customer service, and collaboration with other IT professionals at BYU-Idaho.

Requirements:

  • Experience in customer service
  • Technical trouble-shooting skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Basic computer skills (i.e., Microsoft Office, the ability to use a web browser, etc.)
  • Ability to use time productively, maximize efficiency, and meet challenging work goals
  • Exceptional analytical skills
  • Ability to work on-campus
  • 3 or more semesters remaining before graduation (required)
  • Adherence to BYUI and IT dress & grooming standards (see below)

DRESS AND GROOMING:

The Information Technology department requires business casual dress and strict adherence to the BYUI grooming standards (shaving exceptions are not recognized) for continued employment. As such, applicants are expected to meet these expectations throughout the entire interview process in order to be considered for employment.

SHIFTS:

Due to the unique nature of the job and consideration of office size constraints, we require all employees to align their work schedules according to a shift-based system, with employees selecting one shift that fits their schedule. All shifts are on a Mon-Fri schedule with optional Saturday shifts available, as well. Currently, we are hiring for Fall 2022 semester. Students who can work the last two weeks of Summer break for training will be preferred.

  • Team 1: 7:30-11am (17 hrs)
  • Team 2: 11-2pm (15 hrs) Available
  • Team 3: 2-5pm (15 hrs) Available
  • Team 4: 5-8pm (15 hrs)
  • Full-time: 8-5pm (40 hrs)

REQUIRED DOCUMENTS:

  • Resume
  • Cover Letter (addressed to IT Service Desk Hiring Committee)
  • Letter(s) of Recommendation (optional)

IMPORTANT:

We do not accept applications to this job board. Instead, we have an online hiring tool that allows us to perform digital interviews from pre-recorded video responses. Your digital interview may take up to 25 minutes to complete. So please prepare accordingly. As it is an official interview, please treat it as such, including wearing appropriate business attire. When you are ready to apply, please follow this link:

https://byuidaho.hirevue.com/signup/34VYUFw8Qn8ChNLZgCj4srR/

Applications submitted to this job board and not through the provided link will be dis
summary: The Service Desk provides technical support to all BYU-Idaho end users. This is accomplished by providing customer service through the phone and chat system.

title: Health Center Lab Assistant
description:
PRINCIPLE DUTIES

  • Phlebotomy: Retrieve information regarding which test needs to be performed, enter patient data correctly, and draw blood.
  • Tests: Perform streptococcus, mononucleosis, urinalysis, tuberculosis, and other in-house tests.
  • Stocking: Manage inventory by restocking lab supplies from storage as needed.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Education and Work Experience: 3 months of phlebotomy experience or equivalent preferred.
  • Skill Set: Ability to think critically, communicate clearly, multitask, keep organized, manage time wisely, behave professionally, practice hospitality, accept direction from others, provide responsible leadership, take initiative to complete tasks, remain self-motivated, work quickly and accurately under pressure, and work well in groups. Basic understanding and working knowledge of computers. This lab position offers an opportunity to work in a CLIA certified laboratory and learn all aspects of a clinical laboratory.  Laboratory management opportunities and internships are available.
  • License or Certification: Phlebotomy certificate, or other certification such as MA, CMA, RN, CLA, etc. Previous phlebotomy experience required. Must provide a physical copy of high school transcript.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

  • Please do not apply through this website. Email your resume, cover letter, graduation date, and class schedule to HealthCenterLabManager@byui.edu

IMPORTANT: All employees of the Student Health Center are required to receive or have record of the following immunizations: 
     TB (must be updated annually)
     FLU (must be current for this season)
     TDAP (must be updated every 10 years)
     MMR (2 doses)
     VARICELLA (Chicken pox - 2 doses)
     HEPATITIS B (3 doses)

NOTE: The Student Health Center can administer most immunizations as necessary. All student employees are financially responsible for completing this requirement. You will be requested to provide records during general training. The SHC must have record of the above immunizations before on-the-job training begins.
summary: Assist lab manager in phlebotomy, performance of tests, and organization of lab. Strengthen connection between lab and health care providers by ensuring that tests are completed in a timely manner and all lab results are reported accurately. This position is for an experienced phlebotomist with a certificate in phlebotomy, medical assisting, or ENT.

title: Teleprompter Operator
description:
This position is for Fall Semester, but preference will be given to those who can train during the summer.

Excellent command of English language, spelling and grammar. Excellent keyboard and computer skills. Familiarity with Microsoft Word. Well groomed and dressed. Able to work in close environment with others. Must have good hygiene.  Communication skills a must. Steady hand-eye coordination needed.  If we return to in person graduation, you must be available to work on graduation day each semester. A plus if you are an English major or minor.  Hopefully will have at least two years left in schooling.  Hiring for long term. Must have fun.
summary:
Please read whole description before applying.  Setting up, prepping, running and striking teleprompter for Devotional and other meetings and events. This is a slightly stressful work environment. Most work happens 
Tuesday between 8:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m., so you must be available this time slot. There may be other events during the week that will need support.
Looking for Year Round.

title: Student Project Manager
description:
The student project manager position undertakes a series of different tasks in the media development section of Online Curriculum Development. Common duties include:

  • Day-to-day administrative tasks within the video department office.
  • Manage events and communication between clients, cast, crew, and producers.
  • Manage the pre-production and production elements required for filming, including props, locations, actors, special equipment, etc.
  • Manage delivery and storage of media assets. 
  • Maintain an active roll assisting in all aspects of audio, video, and film production. 

Ideal Candidate:

  • Business, Communication or related major desired.
  • On active track in the project management profession.
  • Substantial understanding and experience with common Microsoft and Google tools such as docs, spreadsheets, calendar, preferred.
  • Demonstrable writing, communication, and multi-tasking skills.
summary: Assist in managing the audiovisual section of Online Curriculum Development.

title: A/V & Broadcast Productions Lighting Crew
description:
We are looking for students seeking practical experience while helping our team achieve our goals and objectives.  We need several students with different experience in a number of areas (explained below).

All students must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be responsible, self-motivated, self-starter, personable, teachable and well organized. 
  • Superior customer service skills to deal with both internal and external customers.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. 
  • Must be able to effectively handle stressful situations.
  • Must be able lift at least 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work comfortably at heights.
  • Minimum of two semesters of school left
  • Ability to work nights and weekends.
  • Be able to creatively interpret ideas as well as follow directions.

Students must have experience in at least three (or more) of the following areas:

  • Ability to use and understand various kinds of test equipment, tools, and meters such as volt, ohm, and amp meters.
  • Basic understanding of electrical principles, formulas, drawings and stage lighting plots.
  • Previous experience of controlling and operating conventional and moving light consoles. 
  • Ability to hang, and focus theatrical lighting fixtures.
  • Experience using a follow spot
  • Interest and experience in entertainment production.
  • Experience Operating Scissor Lifts, Forklifts, boom lifts, etc.
  • Experience with stage rigging installation, maintenance, and operation.
  • Experience with computer network troubleshooting. 
  • Experience with electronics repair.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Graphic Designer for the Department of Music. Responsibilities include designing posters, CVN ads, web banners, Facebook and event calendar ads for upcoming department events. A very busy department with over 25 events every semester.

  • Successful completion of COMM or ART 130 is required.
  • Must be proficient in Photo Shop and Illustrator.
  • Only those applicants with a portfolio (online or physical) will be considered.
summary: Create posters and digital ads for department events.

title: Employer Relations Content Creator
description:
The Employer Relations Content Creator will be responsible for creating and developing content and resources including engaging graphics, videos, editing, and more. This position will also design and create media for these campaigns and be directly involved with developing and implementing Career Center initiatives related to Employer Relations. We’re looking for motivated communication or marketing-minded students.

Required skills needed for this position:

Social media

Illustrator

Photo Shop

InDesign

Canva

Premiere Pro

Must be comfortable interacting with students, faculty, and staff. Students from all majors with these skills are encouraged to apply!

Must be able to work Monday-Friday.
summary: Come join the growing and exciting BYU-Idaho Career Center team. We are hiring for a Content Creator for the Employer Relations team for Fall semester.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 20 hours

title: Office Employee for Academic Leadership Office
description:
The Academic Administration Office has a position available for a student office employee. This position will assist the Associate Academic Vice Presidents and Administrative Assistants with various projects. This role will require you to greet visitors to the office, answer incoming phone calls, direct walk-ins, schedule rooms, transcribe meeting minutes, stock and order office supplies, and work on other office projects as assigned.

Ideal candidates will be friendly, prompt, self-motivated, and professional.  They will be detail oriented and possess proficient skills in proofreading and editing, with a high level of competency in Microsoft Office programs, especially Excel.

Prospective employees must be available to work 11:00 am-2:00 pm Monday through Friday for Fall Semester.  With a total 15 hours a week.

Applicants who are able to work for three or more semesters before graduating are preferred.

To apply, please send your resume along with a copy of your class schedule and most current unofficial transcript to academicoffice@byui.edu
summary: The Academic Administration Office has a position available for a student office employee. This position will assist the Associate Academic Vice Presidents and Administrative Assistants with various projects. This role will require you to greet visitors to the office, answer incoming phone calls, direct walk-ins, schedule rooms, transcribe meeting minutes, stock and order office supplies, and work on office projects as needed.  Excellent Microsoft skills a must.

title: Male Art Model
description:
BEFORE APPLYING PLEASE READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS VERY CAREFULLY. FAILURE TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS COULD RESULT IN US NOT REVIEWING YOUR APPLICATION.

The Art Department hires students each semester to model for Art classes. We are interested in a variety of models with different hair styles, coloring, and body types. All models will be expected to model as both head AND figure models. If you are unwilling to work as a figure model for whatever reason, you will not be hired.

Head modeling: Art students will draw/paint/sculpt models from the shoulders up.

Figure modeling: Art students will draw/paint/sculpt the entire figure. Men wear compression bottoms. (Modeling Uniform is provided by the Art Department.)

Models must be dependable and punctual for scheduled time. Class cannot start without them! Models will be expected to sit very still in poses but will be given breaks every 25 minutes during the class time. We rotate models to give a variety of faces and figures for students to draw.

How to apply:

1. Review this list to see if you are available to model for AT LEAST THREE of the following class times:

MW 11:15 am- 2:30 pm 

MW 2:30 pm-5:45 pm

T/Th 8:00 am-11:15 am

T/Th 12:30 pm- 3:45 pm

T/Th 7:00 pm-10:00 pm

F 8:45 am-12:00 pm

F 9:45 am-1:00 pm

2. If you are available for AT LEAST THREE of the above class times, please email us at art_dept@byui.edu with subject line "Model Application." Include the following information:

a. Your first and last name

b. Your phone number

c. Your email (whichever you check most frequently)

d. The class time you are available to model for (DO NOT send us your student schedule.)

e. Have you worked as a model in the BYUI Art Department before? If so, when?

f. Attach a full body CLOTHED photo of yourself.

3. After we review the applications, you will receive an email informing you whether or not you were hired and be given additional instructions to complete the hiring process. This takes a couple weeks, and we are closed between semesters, so we ask you to please be patient. If hired, you will be notified about a mandatory meeting for all models. We will share more detailed information at this meeting the first week of the new semester.

Scheduling: We use many models for each class. Because art students need to experience a variety of models, you will be scheduled on a rotation through the classes you are available for (so they don't see the same head or figure each week). As such, you will NOT be working every shift you are available for- you'll be put in a scheduling rotation. Once the schedule is given to you, you will be expected to be at the scheduled class on time, dressed as needed, and ready to model. Failure to show up for your scheduled time will result in dismissal.

***Typically, models average between 3 and 6 hours a week.
summary: Head and Figure Model for Art Classes
approximateHoursPerWeek: varies

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

description:
This course uses a "pooled TA" model. The TAs hired for this course are to be spread throughout the week to be available to help with the "Teaching Ticket" assignment. IT will be the TAs job to run Teach One Another sessions and check off that students understand their assignment. TAs will also reach out to specific "at risk" student groups as directed by an assigned BIO 264 instructor. 10 hours per week.

The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah

title: Chemistry Stockroom/TA/Grader
description:
This is a general application form for any open positions in the chemistry department for the upcoming semester. Tasks vary by position. Teaching Assistants help with labs, Graders grade labs, and Stockroom Assistants set up labs and prepare lab chemicals. Hours vary based on position. The number and type of positions are based on the labs offered by the department.

  • To be considered for any position, the applicant must have completed Chemistry 105. Preference will be given to students who received at least a B in the course

To obtain an application, download the spreadsheet linked below. Using Microsoft Excel, complete the spreadsheet to specify which positions you are interested in and to indicate your availability for work. Attach the completed Excel spreadsheet to your application as your resume, or email it to Brother Wood (woodmic@byui.edu).  

Application Spreadsheet

  • Incomplete applications or .pdf copies of the spreadsheet will not be considered

Remote TA positions have several additional requirements:

  • A stable internet connection
  • A computer with a Webcam
  • A willingness to engage students via Zoom for 2-3 hours per shift.
  • Must be living in the state of Utah or Idaho

Please contact Brother Wood with any questions regarding available positions or the application process.
summary: General Application form for all chemistry department positions. These positions include stockroom assistants(SA), teaching assistants(TA), and Graders. Certain positions may be hired for remote work.

title: Security-Lock up Patrol
description:
Employees will assist with patrolling campus building, locking and securing all interior and exterior doors in campus buildings. Employees will also assist Campus patrol officers with event security and other security issues that occur on campus.

This job includes working evenings, weekends including Sunday.

title: Music Production Team (Music Dept.)
description:
This position supports productions for the Department of Music. Ideal candidates will have the following:

  • Audio technician/recording/engineering and live sound experience and working knowledge (i.e. behavior/properties of sound, psychoacoustics, signal flow, gain staging, SFX, mic placement, polar patterns, monitoring, signal processors, editing/mixing).
  • DAW proficiency and experience, preferably Pro Tools
  • Basic video camera knowledge and operation skills
  • Basic stage skills and knowledge for supporting classical music ensembles (i.e. instrumentation within an orchestra, etc.)
  • Tues. - Fri. evenings after 5:30pm and all day Saturdays must be generally available to work a varied work schedule based upon event needs and times.
  • Good communication, organization, dependability, punctuality, interpersonal, and team skills
  • The ability to work well under tight deadlines and stressful situations
  • The ability to be proactive and take initiative to solve issues independently
  • The ability to remember and pay attention to production details that support the musical arts

Apply via HireVue at: https://byuidaho.hirevue.com/signup/VYX5bzUUgNvxAXYiaC8HCY/
summary: Audio, video, and stage production support for Department of Music events (choir, orchestra, band, jazz). See the Job Description for how to apply.
workSchedule: Varied, avg. 12 hr/week. Click for full details
